conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and School_C is my first choice. I’m applying because I’m confident your academic environment and community are the best fit for me, and if admitted I would commit fully and contribute positively to campus life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), while Student_B and Student_A rank School_C highly and have higher priority. I have the highest priority at School_E, and several students (A, B, D) rank School_E as their first choice, so competition will be intense there too—but I can secure it if I apply. However, since the objective is to match as high as possible on my true list, I should first attempt School_C with an early application to see if they will accept; if rejected, I can pivot quickly in later rounds to School_E where I am top priority as a safety. Therefore I will apply to School_C now with a strong, specific appeal.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_C as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We sincerely appreciate your interest and wish you the best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4th (B, A, D ahead). In round 1, Student_B is likely to apply to us soon (2nd choice after School_E) and we rank them #1; Student_A may come later (5th choice), and Student_D unlikely (5th choice). Accepting E now would fill our only seat and prevent taking B if they apply. Since E’s top choice is us, rejecting risks losing them, but our objective is to match as high as possible on our priority list; thus we should hold the seat for a potential higher-priority applicant, especially Student_B. Therefore reject now (no waitlist mechanism).

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions—I'm Student_A. School_E is my clear first choice, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat and would be honored to be considered for admission.
conversation.thought: Apply immediately to my top choice, School_E. I have strong priority there (3rd), behind Student_E and Student_B; if I delay, I risk losing the only seat to them. An early [APPLY] maximizes my chance to secure my first-choice match before others commit elsewhere.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best with your next-choice options.

On School_E’s true priority list the ranking among these is Student_B (2nd) > Student_A (3rd) > Student_D (4th). Since Student_B is available and has applied to us this round, accepting Student_A now would block a higher-priority match. Therefore reject Student_A to preserve capacity for Student_B. Student_A’s preferences place School_E first, so a rejection will push them to next choices, while School_E can still secure Student_B who also ranks School_E first.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first choice, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if admitted and would be honored to take a seat if offered. Thank you for your consideration.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for re-applying and for your continued strong interest in School_C. Therefore accepting Student_E now risks blocking a top choice. Since we can reject and keep seat open, do so.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m Student_E. I understand I was previously not offered admission due to priority, but since School_C still has an open seat, I would like to submit one final formal application and reaffirm that School_C is my first choice.

If admitted now, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling. If you are still waiting on higher-priority candidates, I respectfully ask to be considered in the event they do not take the seat—so the place can be filled by a student who is fully ready to commit to School_C.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I will reaffirm that I will accept immediately if offered and ask to be considered if higher-priority candidates are no longer pursuing the spot.

Student_E,
